steps.Name: Install Vlocity Cards DataPacks (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Base Cards DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Base Mobile Cards DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Campaign Cards DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Customer Interaction Cards DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Insurance Product Model Cards DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Product Selection Cards DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Vlocity Templates Datapacks (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Base Template DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Base Mobile Template DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Insurance OmniScript Template DataPack (New Vlocity Installation Only)
Install Base Cards DataPack (Upgrade Only)
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to the Vlocity Cards page.
  2. Click the down arrow, then choose BaseVlocityCards.
  3. On the Select Items to Import window, make sure that everything is selected, then click Next.
  4. Click Next again, then click Activate Now.
  5. On the Select Items to Activate window, make sure that everything is selected, then click Next.
  6. Click Done.
  7. Click the down arrow, then choose MobileVlocityCards.. Repeat steps 3-6.
  8. Click the down arrow, then choose CustomerInteractionCards.. Repeat steps 3-6.

steps.Name: Install Insurance Cards DataPack (Upgrade Only)
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to the Vlocity Cards page.
  2. Click the down arrow, then choose VlocityInsProductModelCards.
  3. On the Select Items to Import window, make sure that everything is selected, then click Next.
  4. Click Next again, then click Activate Now.
  5. On the Select Items to Activate window, make sure that everything is selected, then click Next.
  6. Click Done.
  7. Click the down arrow, then choose VlocityInsProductSelectionCards. Repeat steps 3-6.
  8. Click the down arrow, then choose VlocityCampaignBaseCards. Repeat steps 3-6.

steps.Name: Install Base Templates Datapacks (Upgrade Only)
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to the Vlocity Templates page.

2. Click the down arrow, then choose Install BaseUITemplates.

3. On the Select Items to Import window, click Next, then click Next again.

4. On the Import Complete window, click Activate Now.

5. On the Select Items to Activate window, click Next, then click Done.

6. Click the down arrow, then choose Install MobileUITemplates, repeat step 2-5.

steps.Name: Install OmniScript Templates Datapacks (Upgrade Only)
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to the Vlocity Templates page.

2. Click the down arrow, then choose VlocityInsOSTemplates.

3. On the Select Items to Import window, click Next, then click Next again.

4. On the Import Complete window, click Activate Now.

5. On the Select Items to Activate window, click Next, then click Done.

steps.Name: Activate Record Pages
steps.Instruction:
The record pages to be activated are delivered in the unmanaged package.

· If there’s no new unmanaged package for this release, and you’re upgrading to a production or full sandbox org, stop here. You don’t need to activate any record pages. (They’re already activated.)

· If you’ve just installed a new unmanaged package, complete the steps to activate the record pages you need.

· If you’re upgrading a partial sandbox org with an existing unmanaged package installed, check the record pages described in these steps. If these record pages aren’t active, go through the steps to activate them.

steps.Name: Activate Product Page
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to Setup > Lightning App Builder.
  2. Next to Product record page, click Clone
  3. Change Label and Developer Name or use default values set by system, click on Save
  4. On popup, click Activation.
  5. On the Activation page, click App, Record Type, and Profile, then click Assign to Apps, Record Types, and Profiles. 
  6. On the Select Apps window, choose the apps you want to have access to this record, then click Next.
  7. On the Select Form Factor window, choose the Form Factor that should have access to the Record Page, then click Next.
  8. On the Selected Record Types window, select Product record type, then click Next.
  9. On the Selected Profiles window, select all the user profiles you want to have access to this record, then click Next.
  10. On the Review Assignments window, confirm that you've made all the correct selections for this record based on your business needs, then click Save.

steps.Name: Activate Product Coverage / Insured Items Page
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to Setup > Lightning App Builder.
  2. Next to Product - Coverage / Insured Items record page, click Clone.
  3. Change Label and Developer Name or use default values set by system, click on Save
  4. On popup, click Activation.
  5. On the Activation page, click App, Record Type, and Profile, then click Assign to Apps, Record Types, and Profiles.
  6. On the Select Apps window, choose the apps you want to have access to this record, then click Next.
  7. On the Select Form Factor window, choose the Form Factor that should have access to the Record Page, then click Next.
  8. On the Selected Record Types window, select Product record type, select the following record types, then click Next.
    1. Insured Item Spec
    2. Coverage Spec
    3. Insured Party Spec
    4. Rating Fact Spec
  9. On the Selected Profiles window, select all the user profiles you want to have access to this record, then click Next.
  10. On the Review Assignments window, confirm that you've made all the correct selections for this record based on your business needs, then click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Account Record Types
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to Setup -> Profiles
  2. Click the name of a profile, then scroll down to Record Type Settings
  3. In Standard Record Type Settings, find Account and click Edit.
  4. Select all record types that the profile needs to access, then click Add.
  5. Select a Default.
  6. Click Save.

  6. Click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Provider Contact License Record Types
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to Setup -> Profiles
  2. Click the name of a profile, then scroll down to Record Type Settings
  3. In Custom Record Type Settings, find Provider Contact License and click Edit.
  4. Select Program and Taxonomy, then click Add.
  5. Select a Default.
  6. Click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Vlocity Calculation Matrix Record Types
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to Setup -> Profiles
  2. Click the name of a profile, then scroll down to Record Type Settings
  3. In Custom Record Type Settings, find Vlocity Calculation Matrix and click Edit.
  4. Select Standard, Grouped and Row-Versioned, then click Add.
  5. Select Standard as Default.
  6. Click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Claim Line Item Record Types
steps.Instruction:
1. Go to Setup -> Profiles
  2. Click the name of a profile, then scroll down to Record Type Settings
  3. In Custom Record Type Settings, find Claim Line Item and click Edit.
  4. Select Claim Line Item and Line Item Adjustment, then click Add.
  5. Select Claim Line Item as Default.
  6. Click Save.

steps.Name: Set RetainProductAttribJSON Custom Setting
steps.Instruction:
1. From Setup, enter Custom Settings into the Quick Find box and click the link to go to the Custom Settings page.
  2. Click CPQ Configuration Setup > Manage.
  3. In Name, enter RetainProductAttribJSON.
  4. In Setup Value, enter false
  5. Click Save.

steps.Name: Set ShareProductImage Custom Setting
steps.Instruction:
1. From Setup, enter Custom Settings into the Quick Find box and click the link to go to the Custom Settings page
  2. Find Trigger Setup custom setting
  3. Click on Manage button
  4. add ContentDocumentLink.ShareProductImage and check Trigger On checkbox

steps.Name: Product Rule Field Set
steps.Instruction:
The underwriting rules definition uses this field set to retrieve fields.

If you define this field set, only the fields you specifically added are available to underwriting rules. If you do not define this field set, all fields are available to underwriting rules.

  1. Go to Setup > Object Manager
  2. Choose Quote, Asset, or Contract.
  3. Choose Field Sets, then click New.
  4. Enter the following:
    1. In Field Set Name, enter FieldsAvailableInRules.
    2. In Field Set Label, enter a label of your choice.
    3. In Where is this used, enter a description of this field set.
    4. Click Save.
  5. Drag the fields you want available for rules onto the In the Field Set box. The field Set can not be empty.
  6. Click Save.

steps.Name: Configuring Deep Product Cloning
steps.Instruction:
You can configure Vlocity to deep clone an insurance policy product; that is, to clone the coverage specs, insured item specs, rating facts, rules, attributes, and pricebook entries of the policy product.

Vlocity uses a custom Visualforce page to deep clone policy products.

You can either configure Vlocity to override the existing Clone button on the Product page, or you can leave the Clone button as-is and create a custom button for deep cloning on the Product page.

To override the existing Clone button: 

  1. Go to Setup > Object Manager
  2. Choose Products > Buttons, Links, and Actions.
  3. Next to Clone, click Edit.
  4. Select Visualforce Page, then specify InsuranceProductCloner.
  5. Click Save.

To create a custom deep clone button: 

  1. Go to Setup > Object Manager
  2. Choose Products > Buttons, Links, and Actions.
  3. Click New Button or Link.
  4. In Content Source, select Custom Visualforce.
  5. In Visualforce Page, select InsuranceProductCloner.
  6. Enter a Label and a Name.
  7. Click Save.

steps.Name: Grant Custom Object Permissions
steps.Instruction:
1. In Lightning, go to Setup and navigate to Profiles. Click the profile you want to grant permissions to.
  2. From the profile, click Edit.
  3. Scroll to the Custom Object Permissions section.
  4. Select each type of access you want to give to the Vlocity users with this profile for each custom object.
  5. Click Save.

steps.Name: Adding Create New Version Button to Calculation Matrix and Calculation Procedure
steps.Instruction:
The buttons that let you create new versions of calculation matrices and calculation procedures exist in Vlocity Insurance, but they aren't included in the page layouts by default.

To add the Create New Version button to the Vlocity Calculation Matrix Version page: 

  1. Go to Setup > Objects > Object Manager.
  2. Select Vlocity Calculation Matrix Version.
  3. Select Page Layouts, then choose Vlocity Pricing Matrix Version Layout.
  4. In the top panel, click Mobile & Lightning Actions.
  5. In the main panel, under Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Experience Actions, click override the predefined actions.
  6. Drag Create New Version from the top panel down into the Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Experience Actions area.
  7. In the top panel, click Save.


To add the Create New Version button to the Vlocity Calculation Procedure Version page: 

  1. Go to Setup > Objects > Object Manager.
  2. Select Vlocity Calculation Procedure Version.
  3. Select Page Layouts, then choose Pricing Procedure Version Layout.
  4. In the top panel, click Mobile & Lightning Actions.
  5. In the main panel, under Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Experience Actions, click override the predefined actions.
  6. Drag Create New Version from the top panel down into the Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Experience Actions area.
  7. In the top panel, click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Platform Cache for Product Attributes
steps.Instruction:
Note: Don't enable the platform cache in any of your development environments. It is intended to speed performance in production and performance test environments. It can cause problems when you're actively developing in Vlocity.


To enable caching in Vlocity, you must first enable the platform cache in your org. The CPQPartition is part of insurance managed package. Cache space needs to be allocated to Organization Level Cache (minimum of 5 MB).


To enable the platform cache:

  1. In Lighting view, go to Setup > Custom Settings.
  2. Go to CPQ Configuration Setup and click Manage. 
  3. In Name, enter CacheEnabled.
  4. In Value, enter: true (or True).
  5. Click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Platform Cache for Product Ratings
steps.Instruction:
To enable caching in Vlocity, you must first enable the platform cache in your org. Cache space needs to be allocated to Organization Level Cache (minimum of 5 MB).


To enable the platform cache: 

  1. In Lighting view, go to Setup > Custom Settings.
  2. Go to General Settings and click Manage.
  3. In Name, enter CalculationProcedureCachePartition.
  4. In Value, enter RatingCache.
  5. Click Save.

steps.Name: Enable Push Attribute in Batch Mode
steps.Instruction:
If your product spec is reference by large number of products and you are hitting sales force limit in push attribute, you can enable push attribute in batch mode.


To enable the push attribute batch mode: 

  1. In Lighting view, go to Setup > Custom Settings.
  2. Go to Insurance Configuration Setup and click Manage.
  3. In Name, enter PushAttributeInBatchMode.
  4. In Value, enter true.
  5. Click Save.

steps.Name: Install CustomFieldMap
steps.Instruction:
You need to install CustomFieldMap DataPack.

Follow these steps to verify the mapping:

  1. Navigate to Field Mapper screen.
  2. On the Source Object dropdown menu, choose Product<Product2> and from the Destination Object dropdown menu, choose Quote Line Item<QuoteLineItem>.
  3. Click Load Settings.
  4. Verify the mapped fields listed on the Fields Map panel.
  5. Add other custom field mappings from Product to Quote Line Item as needed.
  6. On the Source Object dropdown menu, choose Contract<Contract> and from the Destination Object dropdown menu, choose Quote<Quote>.
  7. Click Load Settings.
  8. Verify the mapped fields listed on the Fields Map panel.
  9. Add other custom field mappings from Contract to Quote as needed.
  10. On the Source Object dropdown menu, choose Census Member<GroupCensusMember__c> and from the Destination Object dropdown menu, choose Contact<Contact>.
  11. Click Load Settings.
  12. Verify the mapped fields listed on the Fields Map panel.
  13. Add other custom field mappings from Census Member to Contact as needed.
  14. On the Source Object dropdown menu, choose Quote<Quote> and from the Destination Object dropdown menu, choose Asset<Asset>.
  15. Click Load Settings.
  16. Verify the mapped fields listed on the Fields Map panel.
  17. Add other custom field mappings from Quote to Asset as needed.
  18. On the Source Object dropdown menu, choose Asset<Asset> and from the Destination Object dropdown menu, choose Quote<Quote>.
  19. Click Load Settings.
  20. Verify the mapped fields listed on the Fields Map panel.
  21. Add other custom field mappings from Asset to Quote as needed.

steps.Name: Run Fix Product Attribute Metadata Batch
steps.Instruction: Click Complete Step to start the batch job and check batch job status.

steps.Name: Enable Platform Cache for State Model
steps.Instruction:
NOTE: Do not enable the platform cache in any of your development environments. It is intended to speed performance in production and performance test environments. It can cause problems when you're actively developing in Vlocity.


To enable caching in Vlocity, you must first enable the platform cache in your org. Cache space needs to be allocated to Organization Level Cache (minimum of 5 MB).


To enable the platform cache:

  • In Lighting view, go to Setup > Custom Settings.
  • Go to General Settings and click Manage.
  • In Name, enter StateModelRulesCachePartition.
  • In Value, enter VlocityMetaData.
  • Click Save.
